corpname.value: Poly Archives & Special Collections at Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology

unittitle.value: Guide to the Henry Jasik Papers, 1948-1987

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: Henry Jasik (1919-1977) was a prominent scientist in the field of antenna engineering. After completing his doctoral studies in Electrical Engineering at the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn in 1953, he went on to found his own company, Jasik Laboratories, Inc. Jasik maintained his ties to Polytechnic, working closely with the Microwave Research Institute throughout his career. His Antenna Engineering Handbook, first published in 1961, is still widely referenced today.

p.value: Identification of item, date; RG-029: Henry Jasik Papers; box number, folder number; Poly Archives & Special Collections at Bern Dibner Library of Science and Technology.
Source: “Dedication.” Antenna Engineering Handbook: Third Edition, Richard Johnson, ed., McGraw-Hill, New York, 1993.

The collection also contains biographical information about Jasik, his connection to Polytechnic's Microwave Research Institute, and memoranda detailing the donation of Jasik's library to the Polytechnic Institute of New York.
